terms.definition: The specific laws of a particular jurisdiction chosen to interpret and enforce the terms of a contract.
A formal phrase typically used to introduce the signature block of a legal document, affirming the parties' agreement.
A person or entity hired to perform work for another, who controls their own work methods, rather than being an employee.
A transitional word used in legal documents to introduce the main operative part of an agreement after background statements.
A formal word used to introduce the operative clauses of a legal document, often indicating a conclusion from previous statements.
A formal introductory word used in legal documents to state background facts, circumstances, or reasons leading up to the main agreement.
A person authorized to act on behalf of another person (the principal) in dealings with third parties.

terms.term: as of the date first above written
terms.definition: Refers to the effective date specified at the beginning of a legal document, indicating when the agreement formally begins.
Clauses in a contract that specify which jurisdiction's laws will govern the interpretation and enforcement of the agreement.
Clauses in a contract designed to resolve which jurisdiction's laws apply when multiple jurisdictions might have a claim.
A phrase indicating that the interpretation of a contract's terms will follow the rules and principles of a specified law or jurisdiction.
Formal promises or agreements within a contract that obligate one or more parties to do or refrain from doing certain actions.
The specific date indicated at the beginning of a legal document, often signifying its effective date.
When a contract has been fully signed by all necessary parties, making it legally binding.
A phrase indicating what one party gives or does in exchange for what the other party gives or does, forming the basis of a contract.
An individual or entity involved in a specific, limited-duration business undertaking with another party, sharing risks and profits.

terms.term: made and entered into as of
terms.definition: A phrase indicating the effective date from which a contract or agreement officially takes effect.
Agreements and commitments made by all parties to a contract to do or not do certain things.
An individual who shares ownership, profits, and responsibilities of a business with one or more others.
The main location where a company's management is conducted and key decisions are made.
Confidential business information that gives a company a competitive advantage because it is not generally known.
